parse.title: List of international presidential trips made by Dmitry Medvedev

text.*:
World map highlighting countries visited by Dmitry Medvedev during his presidency.

This is a list of international trips made by Dmitry Medvedev, during his presidency, he made 102 international trips to different countries.

This article is part of
a series about
Dmitry Medvedev

Prime Minister of Russia

2008[edit]

BRIC leaders in 2008
Medvedev with President of Peru Alan García Pérez.
Medvedev with Muammar Gaddafi.
  • Kazakhstan 22—23 May — first official visit as President (Astana).[1][2]
  • China 23—25 May — official visit to China.[3]
  • Germany 5 June — official visit to Germany (Berlin).[4][5]
  • Belarus 22 June — official visit to Brest.[6][7]
  • Azerbaijan 3 July — Official visit to Azerbaijan.[8]
  • Turkmenistan 4 July — Official visit to Turkmenistan.[9]
  • Kazakhstan 5—6 July — official visit to Kazakhstan (Astana) part of CIS Summit.[10]
  • Japan 7—8 July — — official visit to Japan (Tokyo, Hokkaido) as part of G8 Summit.[11]
  • Tajikistan 28—29 August — official visit to Tajikistan (Dushanbe), meeting with SCO leaders.[12]
  • Kazakhstan 22 September — visit to Kazakhstan (Aktobe).[13]
  • France 8 October — Conference of world politics in France.[14]
  • Kyrgyzstan 9 October - Official visit to Bishkek.[15]
  • Armenia 10 October - Official visit to Yerevan.[16]
  • France 13–14 November - Visit to Nice.[17]
  • US November 15–16 - official visit to Washington D.C [18]
Dmitry Medvedev and the President Venezuela Hugo Chavez.
  • Peru November 24 - official visit to Lima.[19]
  • Brazil November 25–26 - official visit to Rio de Janeiro.[20]
  • Venezuela November 27 - official visit to Caracas. Medvedev became the first Russian president to visit Venezuela.[21]
  • Cuba November 28 - visit to Havana. Met with Raul Castro, and Fidel Castro.[22][23]
  • India December 4–5 - official visit to New Delhi.[24]
  • Kazakhstan December 19 - visit to Kazakhstan.[25]

2009[edit]

London, United Kingdom, 1 April 2009
G20 Summit, London, United Kingdom, 2 April 2009
G8, Italy, 8 July 2009
  • Uzbekistan January 22–23 - official visit to Tashkent and Samarkand.[26]
  • Italy March 1 - official visit to Bari.[27]
  • Spain March 2–3 - official visit to Madrid [28] Medvedev was handed the key to Madrid.[29]
  • Germany March 31 - visit to Berlin.[30]
  • Great Britain 1–2 April - official visit to London. attended the G20 summit.
  • Nigeria June 24 - official visit Abuja[31]
  • Namibia June 25–26 - official visit to Windhoek.[32]
  • Angola June 26 - official visit to Luanda.[33]
  • Finland April 20–21 - state visit to Helsinki.[34]
  • Netherlands June 19–20 - official visit to Amsterdam
  • Egypt June 23–24 - visit to Cairo.
  • Azerbaijan June 29 - working visit to Baku
  • Italy 8–10 July - official visit
  • South Ossetia July 13 - working visit to South Ossetia.
  • Tajikistan July 30–31 - official visit to Dushanbe. Met with Asif Ali Zardari, Emomali Rahmon, and Hamid Karzai
  • Kyrgyzstan July 31-August 1 - official visit to (Cholpon-Ata). Attended the CSTO summit.
  • Mongolia 25–26 August - official visit to Mongolia. Attended the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of the Battle of Khalkhin-Gol.
  • Kazakhstan 11–12 September - working visit to Kazakhstan, attended an informal meeting of the Presidents of Russia, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan and Turkmenistan in Aktau.
  • Turkmenistan September 13 - Attended the Silk Way Rally in Turkmenbashi.[35]
  • Switzerland September 21–22 - the first visit by a russiab leader to Switzerland. He visited Kerzat, Bern, and Andermat.[36]
  • United States September 27–28 – Official Visit to New York City, United States to participate in 64th Regular Session of the United Nations General Assembly. Attended the G20 summit in Pittsburgh.
Medvedev in Chisinau, 9 October 2009.
  • Moldova October 8–9 - Attended the CIS summit.
  • Kazakhstan October 16 - visit to Astana. Attended the final stage of the “Cooperation 2009” military exercises conducted by the Collective Rapid Reaction Force of the CSTO at the Maribulak military training field. of the final phase of the exercises.
  • Serbia October 21 - Official visit to Belgrade, Serbia. 65th anniversary of the liberation of Belgrade.[37]
  • Germany November 9 - working visit to Germany. Attended the celebrations in honor of the 20th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall.
  • Singapore November 15–16 - official visit to Singapore. Attended the APEC.
  • Sweden November 18 - Working Visit
  • Belarus November 27 - Working Visit.
  • Italy December 3 - Working Visit to Italy and the Vatican
  • Denmark December 18 - Attended the UN Summit on Global Climate Change.
  • Kazakhstan December 19 - Working Visit to Almaty.
  • Turkmenistan December 22 - Working Visit to Ashgabat.

2010[edit]

Czech Republic, 8 April 2010
Medvedev in Poland in 2010.
  • France 1–2 March - Visit to Paris.[38]
  • Slovakia 6–7 April - Visit to Bratislava.[39]
  • Czech Republic 7–8 April - Visit to Prague.[40] Attended the signing of the Russian-American Treaty on the reduction and limitation of strategic offensive arms.
  • United States 13–14 April - Attend the Nuclear Security Summit.
  • Argentina 15–16 April - Visit to Bratislava.[41]
  • Brazil 16–18 April - Visit to Brasilia.[42]
  • Poland 18–21 April - Visit to Warsaw.
  • Ukraine 21–26 April - Visit to Kharkov.[43]
  • Norway 26–27 April - Visit to Oslo.[44]
  • Denmark 27–28 April - Visit to Copenhagen.
  • Syria 10–11 May - Visit to Damascus.[45]
  • Turkey 12 May - Visit to Ankara.[46]
  • Ukraine 18 May - Visit to Kiev.[47]
  • Germany 5 June - Visit to Berlin [48]
  • Uzbekistan 10–11 June - Visit to Tashkent.[49] Attended the SCO Summit.
  • US 23–25 June - Visit to San Francisco. Met with the Governor of California Arnold Schwarzenegger[50] He also visited Stanford University [51] Met with Barack Obama in Washington, DC[52]
  • Canada 25–27 June - Visit to Toronto. Attended the G8 and the G20.[53]
  • Kazakhstan 5 July - Working visit.[54]
  • Finland 21 July - Working visit.[55]
  • Italy 23 July - official visit to Milan.[56]
  • Abkhazia August 8 - working visit to Sukhumi and Gudauta.[57]
  • Armenia 20 August - Official visit to Yerevan.[58]
  • Azerbaijan 2–3 September - official visit to Baku[59]
  • Kazakhstan 7 September - Working visit.[60]
  • China 26–28 September - Official visit.[61]
  • Algeria 6 October - Official visit.[62]
  • Cyprus 7 October - Official visit.[63]
  • France 18–19 October - Visit to Deauville.[64]
  • Vietnam 30–31 October - Working visit.[65] Attended the ASEAN summit in Hanoi
  • South Korea November 10–12 - Attended the G20 Summit in Seoul [66]
  • Japan November 10–12 - Attended the APEC Summit in Yokohama [67]
  • Azerbaijan 18 November - working visit to Baku. Attended the Third Caspian Summit.[68]
  • Portugal November 30 - Attended the Russia-Nato Summit in Lisbon [69]
  • Kazakhstan 1 December - Working visit.[70]
  • Poland 6 December - Working visit.[71]
  • Belgium 7–8 December - Visit to Brussels.[72]
  • India 20–21 December - Working visit.[73]

2011[edit]

G8 Summit, France
Medvedev in Ukraine, October 2011.
  • Palestine January 18 - official visit to Jericho.[74]
  • Jordan January 19 - official visit to Amman.[75]
  • China April 13–17 - Attended the BRICS summit in Hong Kong.[76]
  • France May 26–27 - Attended the G8 summit in Deauville.[77]
  • Italy 1–2 June - Working visit.[78]
  • Uzbekistan June 14 - Working visit to Tashkent.[79]
  • Kazakhstan 14—15 June - Working visit.[80]
  • Germany 18–19 July - visit to Hanover.[81]
  • Kazakhstan 12 August - Working visit. Attended the CSTO summit[82]
  • Tajikistan 2—3 September — official visit to Tajikistan (Dushanbe), meeting with CIS leaders.[83]
  • Ukraine 18 October - Working visit to Donetsk.[84]
  • France 3–4 November — G20 summit in Cannes.[85]
  • Germany 7–8 November - Official Visit.[86]
  • US November 15–16 - Attended the APEC summit in Hawaii.[87]
  • Czech Republic 7–8 December - Visit to Prague.[88]
  • Belgium December 15 - Attended the Russia-EU summit in Brussels.[89]

2012[edit]

BRICS, India, 29 March 2012
Medvedev in South Korea, March 2012.
  • South Korea March 26–27 - Attended the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit in Seoul.[90]
  • India March 28–30 - Participated in the BRICS Summit in New Delhi.[91]

  • List of international presidential trips made by Vladimir Putin
